item.title: $#!T People Say (dubstep & Jazz) New Song
item.dc:creator: pendulum
item.description:
more jazz & bitpop than dubstep … and to much clutter… the electronic part is way different than the jazz part. could be 2 different songs mixed together

Read full topic

item.title: $#!T People Say (dubstep & Jazz) New Song
item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
It was good, but there was too much clutter.

The sax and beat should have been louder than everything else; I have no idea what this ^ guy is talking about.
Don’t believe me? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MsBFyylIMIM&t=0m45s

The constantly occurring electric-bass notes kept rising in volume and interfering with the lead.

Advice: Keep the drums and sax at the same level, but drop that electric bass’ volume, but also its frequency so we can hear it at a lower register without it cutting off the Sax. Trust me, you never want to sound-out the lead – it destroys the flow of the song and makes it feel choppy.

Remember, the Sax and Drum Beat carry and lead that song, nothing should be louder than them unless you’re using a clever transition.

Read full topic

item.title: $#!T People Say (dubstep & Jazz) New Song
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
I felt like the electronic sax(?) masked the more subtle things you were trying to do here. It was just too loud compared to everything else, and the only things I could hear clearly were it, the quieter sax playing in the background, and part of the bass track.

Read full topic
